author: Special Correspondent
text:
Water was released from Bhavani Sagar Reservoir on Wednesday for second-crop cultivation in the Lower Bhavani Project ayacut spread over 1.03 lakh hectares in Erode, Tirupur, and Karur districts.

Based on current storage of 76.74 cusecs of water, and anticipated inflow, farmers have been promised of water for 56 days in the LBP canal. On Wednesday, 1,000 cusecs of water was discharged into the Bhavani river, and 500 into LBP canal, against an inflow of 546 cusecs.

Discharge into the dam will be subsequently scaled up. At the same time last year, the water level at the reservoir was 81.47 tmc.

Environment Minister Thoppu N.D. Venkatachalam initiated the water release.

District Collector S. Prabakar; Selvakumara Chinniayan, MP; and B.G. Naryananan, P.L. Sundaram, S.S. Ramanidharan, and R.N. Kittusamy, all MLAs were present.
title: Water released
